001package imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic;
002
003import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
004import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
005
006import java.awt.Point;
007import java.awt.Shape;
008import java.awt.geom.Arc2D;
009import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
010import java.util.Locale;
011
012import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.twod.Vector2D;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
015
016/** 
017 * Interface specifying the behavior of simple 2D points. 
018 * It is used to adapt to different (legacy) point implementations 
019 * with a common API. 
020 * To some extent this is similar to the functionality provided by
021 * {@link Point2D} and {@link Point}
022 * but was re-implemented to avoid dependency on AWT and for
023 * more flexibility in naming and class structure.
024 * Since defined as an interface, {@link Pnt2d} can be easily implemented 
025 * by other point-like structures, e.g. corners 
026 * (see {@link imagingbook.pub.corners.Corner}).
027 * <br>
028 * Two concrete (nested) classes are defined for points with {@code double}
029 * and {@code int} coordinates, respectively.
030 * See {@link Pnt2d.PntDouble} and {@link Pnt2d.PntInt} for how
031 * to instantiate such point objects.
032 * 
033 */
034public interface Pnt2d {
035        
036        /**
037         * The default tolerance for matching coordinates (1E-6).
038         */
039        public final static double TOLERANCE = 1E-6;
040        
041        /**
042         * Returns the x-coordinate of this point.
043         * @return the x-coordinate value
044         */
045        double getX();
046        
047        /**
048         * Returns the y-coordinate of this point.
049         * @return the y-coordinate value
050         */
051        double getY();
052        
053        /**
054         * Returns the x-coordinate of this point as a 
055         * (truncated) integer value.
056         * @return the integer x-coordinate of this point.
057         */
058        public default int getXint() {
059                return (int) this.getX();
060        }
061        
062        /**
063         * Returns the y-coordinate of this point as a 
064         * (truncated) integer value.
065         * @return the integer y-coordinate of this point.
066         */
067        public default int getYint() {
068                return (int) this.getY();
069        }
070        
071        // ----------------------------------------------------------
072        
073        /**
074         * Creates and returns a new point of type {@link Pnt2d.PntInt}
075         * with the specified coordinates.
076         * See also {@link PntInt#from(int, int)}.
077         * @param x coordinate
078         * @param y coordinate
079         * @return the new point
080         */
081        public static Pnt2d from(int x, int y) {
082                return PntInt.from(x, y);
083        }
084        
085        /**
086         * Creates and returns a new point of type {@link Pnt2d.PntInt}
087         * with the specified coordinates.
088         * See also {@link PntInt#from(int[])}.
089         * 
090         * @param xy coordinates
091         * @return the new point
092         */
093        public static Pnt2d from(int[] xy) {
094                return PntInt.from(xy);
095        }
096        
097        /**
098         * Creates and returns a new point of type {@link Pnt2d.PntDouble}
099         * with the specified coordinates.
100         * See also {@link PntDouble#from(double, double)}.
101         * 
102         * @param x coordinate
103         * @param y coordinate
104         * @return the new point
105         */
106        public static Pnt2d from(double x, double y) {
107                return PntDouble.from(x, y);
108        }
109        
110        /**
111         * Creates and returns a new point of type {@link Pnt2d.PntDouble}
112         * with the specified coordinates.
113         * See also {@link PntDouble#from(double[])}.
114         * 
115         * @param xy coordinates
116         * @return the new point
117         */
118        public static Pnt2d from(double[] xy) {
119                return PntDouble.from(xy[0], xy[1]);
120        }
121        
122        public static Pnt2d from(Point2D p) {
123                if (p instanceof Point) {
124                        Point pi = (Point) p;
125                        return PntInt.from(pi.x, pi.y);
126                }
127                else {
128                        return PntDouble.from(p.getX(), p.getY());
129                }
130        }
131        
132        // ----------------------------------------------------------
133        
134        /**
135         * Returns this point's coordinates as a new 2-element {@code double} array.
136         * @return the array
137         */
138        public default double[] toDoubleArray() {
139                return new double[] {this.getX(), this.getY()};
140        }
141        
142        /**
143         * Returns this point's coordinates as a new AWT {@link Point2D.Double} point.
144         * @return the new point
145         */
146        public default Point2D.Double toAwtPoint2D() {
147                return new Point2D.Double(this.getX(), this.getY());
148        }
149        
150        /**
151         * Returns this point's coordinates as a new {@link Vector2D} instance
152         * (for interfacing with Apache Commons Math).
153         * @return a new vector
154         */
155        public default Vector2D toVector2D() {
156                return new Vector2D(getX(), getY());
157        }
158        
159        /**
160         * Returns this point's coordinates as a new {@link RealVector} instance
161         * (for interfacing with Apache Commons Math).
162         * @return a new vector
163         */
164        public default RealVector toRealVector() {
165                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(this.toDoubleArray());
166        }
167        
168        /**
169         * Returns a copy of this point which is of the same type as the original.
170         * @return a new instance.
171         */
172        public default Pnt2d duplicate() {
173                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
174        }
175        
176        /**
177         * Returns a new point whose coordinates are the sum of this point and 
178         * the given point. The concrete type of the returned object depends on the type
179         * of the original points.
180         * @param p the point to be added
181         * @return a new point
182         */
183        public default Pnt2d plus(Pnt2d p) {
184                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
185        }
186        
187        /**
188         * Returns a new point whose coordinates are the sum of this point and 
189         * the specified {@code double} coordinates.
190         * @param dx the x-coordinate to be added 
191         * @param dy the y-coordinate to be added 
192         * @return a new point
193         */
194        public default Pnt2d plus(double dx, double dy) {
195                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
196        }
197        
198        /**
199         * Returns a new point whose coordinates are the sum of this point and 
200         * the specified {@code int} coordinates.
201         * The concrete type of the returned object depends on the type
202         * of the original point.
203         * @param dx the x-coordinate to be added 
204         * @param dy the y-coordinate to be added 
205         * @return a new point
206         */
207        public default Pnt2d plus(int dx, int dy) {
208                return plus((double)dx, (double)dy);
209        }
210        
211        /**
212         * Returns a new point whose coordinates are the difference of this point and 
213         * the given point. The concrete type of the returned object depends on the type
214         * of the original points.
215         * @param p the point to be subtracted
216         * @return a new point
217         */
218        public default Pnt2d minus(Pnt2d p) {
219                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
220        }
221        
222        // ----------------------------------------------------------
223
224        /**
225         * Tests if this point matches the given point, i.e., if
226         * both coordinate differences are zero (&lt; than 
227         * the specified tolerance).
228         *  
229         * @param p the point to be matched to
230         * @param tolerance the tolerance (see also {@link #TOLERANCE}).
231         * @return true if both points match
232         */
233        public default boolean equals(Pnt2d p, double tolerance) {
234                return isZero(this.getX() - p.getX(), tolerance) 
235                        && isZero(this.getY() - p.getY(), tolerance);
236        }
237        
238        // ----------------------------------------------------------
239        
240        /**
241         * Returns the squared L2 distance between this point and the
242         * given point.
243         * 
244         * @param other the other point
245         * @return the squared distance
246         */
247        public default double distanceSq(Pnt2d other) {
248                return sqr(this.getX() - other.getX()) + sqr(this.getY() - other.getY());
249        }
250        
251        /**
252         * Returns the L2 (Euclidean) distance between this point and the
253         * given point. This method is equivalent to {@link #distL2(Pnt2d)}.
254         * 
255         * @param other the other point
256         * @return the distance
257         */
258        public default double distance(Pnt2d other) {
259                return Math.sqrt(this.distanceSq(other));
260        }
261        
262        /**
263         * Returns the L2 (Euclidean) distance between this point and the
264         * given point. This method is equivalent to {@link #distance(Pnt2d)}.
265         * 
266         * @param other the other point
267         * @return the distance
268         */
269        public default double distL2(Pnt2d other) {
270                return distance(other);
271        }
272        
273        /**
274         * Returns the L1 (Manhattan) distance between this point and the
275         * given point. 
276         * 
277         * @param other the other point
278         * @return the distance
279         */
280        public default double distL1(Pnt2d other) {
281                return Math.abs(this.getX() - other.getX()) + Math.abs(this.getY() - other.getY());
282        }
283        
284        public static final double DefaultDotRadius = 1.0;
285        
286        /**
287         * Returns a round dot ({@link Shape} instance) for drawing this point.
288         * 
289         * @param rad the dot radius
290         * @return the shape
291         */
292        public default Shape getShape(double rad) {
293                Shape circ= new Arc2D.Double(
294                        this.getX() - rad, 
295                        this.getY() - rad, 
296                        2 * rad, 2 * rad,
297                        0, 360, Arc2D.CHORD);
298                return circ;
299        }
300        
301        public default Shape getShape() {
302                return getShape(DefaultDotRadius);
303        }
304        
305        // ----------------------------------------------------------
306        
307        /**
308         * Immutable 2D point implementation with {@code double} coordinates.
309         * This class implements the {@link Pnt2d} interface.
310         * A public constructor ({@link #PntDouble(double, double)})
311         * is provided but the preferred way of instantiation is
312         * by one of the static factory methods, such as
313         * {@link #from(double, double)},
314         * {@link #from(double[])}, etc.
315         * Access to the coordinate values is provided by the methods
316         * {@link #getX()} and {@link #getY()}, but the
317         * actual field variables {@link #x}, {@link #y} are also 
318         * publicly accessible (for better performance and less clutter).
319         */
320        public class PntDouble implements Pnt2d {
321                
322                /**
323                 * Singleton point instance with zero coordinates.
324                 */
325                public static final PntDouble ZERO = PntDouble.from(0.0, 0.0);
326
327                /** The (immutable) x-coordinate of this point */
328                public final double x;
329                /** The (immutable) y-coordinate of this point */
330                public final double y;
331
332                /**
333                 * Constructor.
334                 * @param x x-coordinate
335                 * @param y y-coordinate
336                 */
337                protected PntDouble(double x, double y) {
338                        this.x = x;
339                        this.y = y;
340                }
341                
342                @Override
343                public PntDouble duplicate() {
344                        return new PntDouble(this.x, this.y);
345                }
346                
347                // static factory methods ---------------------------------
348                
349                /**
350                 * Returns a new {@link PntDouble} instance.
351                 * @param xy x/y-coordinate array
352                 * @return the new point
353                 */
354                public static PntDouble from(double[] xy) {
355                        return new PntDouble(xy[0], xy[1]);
356                }
357                
358                /**
359                 * Returns a new {@link PntDouble} instance.
360                 * @param x x-coordinate value
361                 * @param y y-coordinate value
362                 * @return the new point
363                 */
364                public static PntDouble from(double x, double y) {
365                        return new PntDouble(x, y);
366                }
367                
368                /**
369                 * Returns a new {@link PntDouble} instance with the same coordinates as the given point.
370                 * Equivalent to {@link #duplicate()}.
371                 * @param p the original point
372                 * @return the new point
373                 */
374                public static PntDouble from(Pnt2d p) {
375                        return new PntDouble(p.getX(), p.getY());
376                }
377                
378                /**
379                 * Returns a new {@link PntDouble} instance
380                 * with the same coordinates as the given AWT {@link Point2D}.
381                 * @param p the original AWT point
382                 * @return the new point
383                 */
384                public static PntDouble from(Point2D p) {
385                        return new PntDouble(p.getX(), p.getY());
386                }
387                
388                /**
389                 * Returns a new {@link PntDouble} instance
390                 * with the same coordinates as the given Apache Commons Math
391                 * {@link Vector2D}.
392                 * @param vec the original coordinate vector
393                 * @return the new point
394                 */
395                public static PntDouble from(Vector2D vec) {
396                        return new PntDouble(vec.getX(), vec.getY());
397                }       
398                
399                // getter methods
400                
401                @Override
402                public double getX() {
403                        return this.x;
404                }
405
406                @Override
407                public double getY() {
408                        return this.y;
409                }
410                
411                @Override
412                public int getXint() {
413                        return (int) this.x;
414                }
415
416                @Override
417                public int getYint() {
418                        return (int) this.y;
419                }
420                
421                
422                // addition -----------------------------------
423                
424                @Override
425                public PntDouble plus(Pnt2d p) {
426                        return new PntDouble(this.x + p.getX(), this.y + p.getY());
427                }
428                
429                @Override
430                public PntDouble plus(double dx, double dy) {
431                        return new PntDouble(this.x + dx, this.y + dy);
432                }
433                
434                // subtraction -----------------------------------
435                
436                @Override
437                public PntDouble minus(Pnt2d p) {
438                        return new PntDouble(this.x - p.getX(), this.y - p.getY());
439                }
440                
441                // equality -----------------------------------
442                
443                @Override
444                public boolean equals(Object p) {
445                        if (this == p) {
446                                return true;
447                        }
448                        if (p instanceof Pnt2d) {
449                                return this.equals((Pnt2d) p, TOLERANCE);
450                        }
451                        return false;
452                }
453                
454                // misc -----------------------------------
455                
456                @Override
457                public String toString() {
458                        return String.format(Locale.US, "%s[%.3f, %.3f]", 
459                                        getClass().getSimpleName(), x, y);
460                }
461                
462                @Override
463            public int hashCode() {     // taken from awt.Point2D.Double
464                long bits = java.lang.Double.doubleToLongBits(this.x);
465                bits ^= java.lang.Double.doubleToLongBits(this.y) * 31;
466                return (((int) bits) ^ ((int) (bits >> 32)));
467            }
468
469        }
470        
471        // ----------------------------------------------------------
472        
473        /**
474         * Immutable 2D point implementation with {@code int} coordinates.
475         * This class implements the {@link Pnt2d} interface.
476         * A public constructor ({@link #PntInt(int, int)})
477         * is provided but the preferred way of instantiation is
478         * by one of the static factory methods, such as
479         * {@link #from(int, int)},
480         * {@link #from(int[])}, etc.
481         * The {@code int} coordinates can only be retrieved via the
482         * publicly accessible field variables {@link #x}, {@link #y},
483         * while the methods {@link #getX()} and {@link #getY()}
484         * return {@code double} values for compatibility reasons.
485         */
486        public class PntInt implements Pnt2d {
487                
488                /**
489                 * Singleton point instance with zero coordinates.
490                 */
491                public static final PntInt ZERO = PntInt.from(0, 0);
492                
493                /** The (immutable) x-coordinate of this point */
494                public final int x;
495                /** The (immutable) y-coordinate of this point */
496                public final int y;
497
498                
499                /**
500                 * Constructor.
501                 * @param x x-coordinate
502                 * @param y y-coordinate
503                 */
504                protected PntInt(int x, int y) {
505                        this.x = x;
506                        this.y = y;
507                }
508                
509                @Override
510                public PntInt duplicate() {
511                        return new PntInt(this.x, this.y);
512                }
513                
514                // static factory methods --------------------------------------
515                
516                /**
517                 * Returns a new {@link PntInt} instance from
518                 * a given point.
519                 * @param p the original point
520                 * @return the new point
521                 */
522                public static PntInt from(PntInt p) {
523                        return new PntInt(p.x, p.y);
524                }
525                
526                /**
527                 * Returns a new {@link PntInt} instance.
528                 * @param x x-coordinate value
529                 * @param y y-coordinate value
530                 * @return the new point
531                 */
532                public static PntInt from(int x, int y) {
533                        return new PntInt(x, y);
534                }
535                
536                /**
537                 * Returns a new {@link PntInt} instance.
538                 * @param xy x/y-coordinates
539                 * @return the new point
540                 */
541                public static PntInt from(int[] xy) {
542                        return new PntInt(xy[0], xy[1]);
543                }
544                
545                /**
546                 * Returns a new {@link PntInt} from a given {@link Pnt2d} instance.
547                 * This only works if the argument is of type {@link Pnt2d.PntInt},
548                 * otherwise an exception is thrown.
549                 * 
550                 * @param p a point of type {@link Pnt2d.PntInt}
551                 * @return the new point
552                 */
553                public static PntInt from(Pnt2d p) {
554                        if (p instanceof PntInt) {
555                                return ((PntInt) p).duplicate();
556                        }
557                        else {
558                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot convert to " +
559                                                        PntInt.class.getSimpleName());
560                        }
561                }
562                
563                /**
564                 * Returns a new {@link PntDouble} instance
565                 * with the same coordinates as the given AWT {@link Point}.
566                 * @param p the original AWT point
567                 * @return the new point
568                 */
569                public static PntInt from(Point p) {
570                        return new PntInt(p.x, p.y);
571                }
572                
573                // getter methods
574
575                @Override
576                public double getX() {
577                        return this.x;
578                }
579
580                @Override
581                public double getY() {
582                        return this.y;
583                }
584                
585                @Override
586                public int getXint() {
587                        return this.x;
588                }
589
590                @Override
591                public int getYint() {
592                        return this.y;
593                }
594                
595                // addition -----------------------------------
596                
597                @Override
598                public PntInt plus(Pnt2d p) {
599                        if (p instanceof PntInt) {               
600                                return new PntInt(this.x + ((PntInt)p).x, this.y + ((PntInt)p).y);
601                        }
602                        else throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot add " + p.getClass().getSimpleName() + " to " +
603                                        this.getClass().getSimpleName());
604                }
605                
606                @Override
607                public PntInt plus(double dx, double dy) {
608                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot add (double, double) to " +
609                                        this.getClass().getSimpleName());
610                }
611                
612                @Override
613                public PntInt plus(int dx, int dy) {
614                        return new PntInt(this.x + dx, this.y + dy);
615                }
616                
617                // subtraction -----------------------------------
618                
619                @Override
620                public PntInt minus(Pnt2d p) {
621                        if (p instanceof PntInt) {               
622                                return new PntInt(this.x - ((PntInt)p).x, this.y - ((PntInt)p).y);
623                        }
624                        else throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot subtract " + p.getClass().getSimpleName() + " from " +
625                                        this.getClass().getSimpleName());
626                }
627                
628                // distance -----------------------------------
629                
630                /**
631                 * Returns the L1 (Manhattan) distance between this point and the
632                 * given point. 
633                 * 
634                 * @param p the other point
635                 * @return the distance
636                 */
637                public int distL1(PntInt p) {
638                        return Math.abs(this.x - p.x) + Math.abs(this.y - p.y);
639                }
640                
641                /**
642                 * Returns the squared L2 distance between this point and the
643                 * given point.
644                 * 
645                 * @param other the other point
646                 * @return the squared distance
647                 */
648                public int distanceSq(PntInt other) {
649                        return sqr(this.x - other.x) + sqr(this.y - other.y);
650                }
651                
652                // equality -----------------------------------
653                
654                @Override
655                public boolean equals(Object p) {
656                        if (this == p) {
657                                return true;
658                        }
659                        if (p instanceof PntInt) {
660                                PntInt pp = (PntInt) p;
661                                return (this.x == pp.x) && (this.y == pp.y);
662                        }
663                        if (p instanceof Pnt2d) {
664                                return this.equals((Pnt2d) p, TOLERANCE);
665                        }
666                        return false;
667                }
668                
669                // misc -----------------------------------
670                
671                @Override
672                public String toString() {
673                        return String.format(Locale.US, "%s[%d, %d]", 
674                                        getClass().getSimpleName(), x, y);
675                }
676                
677                @Override
678                public int hashCode() {
679                        return (17 + this.x) * 37 + this.y;     
680                }
681                
682                
683                /**
684                 * Returns this point's coordinates as a new 2-element {@code int} array.
685                 * @return the array
686                 */
687                public int[] toIntArray() {
688                        return new int[] {this.x, this.y};
689                }
690                
691                /**
692                 * Returns this point's coordinates as a new AWT {@link Point} point.
693                 * @return the new point
694                 */
695                public Point toAwtPoint() {
696                        return new Point(this.x, this.y);
697                }
698
699
700                
701        }
702        
703        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
704        
705//      public static void main(String[] args) {
706//              PntInt a = PntInt.from(10,  7);
707//              PntInt b = PntInt.from(3,  5);
708//              System.out.println(" a = " + a.getClass());
709//              System.out.println(" b = " + b.getClass());
710//              System.out.println("dist1 = " + a.distL1(b));
711//              System.out.println("dist2 = " + a.distL1(b));
712//              
713//      }
714}
